citations.desc: Information as to business; furnishing of same by dealers, exhibitors, operators of auction sales, intermediate handlers, and carriers.
citations.narrative:
According to the licensee, the written program of veterinary care as well as acquisition records were still boxed due to the
recent move. These required records were unavailable for review during this new site inspection. It is important for these
documents be provided to the Aphis official to ensure that the animals have been appropriately acquired and that an
attending veterinarian is employed, under formal arrangements, to provide care for all of the exhibit animals.
Each dealer, exhibitor, operator of an auction sale, intermediate handler, and carrier shall furnish to any APHIS official
any information concerning the business of the dealer, exhibitor, operator of an auction sale, intermediate handler or
carrier which the APHIS official may request in connection with the enforcement of the provisions of the Act, the
regulations and the standards in this subchapter. The information shall be furnished within a reasonable time and as may
be specified in the request for information.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: MAY 17, 2023

The licensee has not developed, documented or followed an appropriate contingency plan as required. The written plan
should have been in place by July 5, 2022. The plan should be signed and reviewed annually. The contingency plan is
necessary to ensure that animals are provided with humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care in the
event of an emergency or disaster.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: MAY 17, 2023
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.125 
   
Information as to business; furnishing of same by dealers, exhibitors, operators of auction sales, intermediate 
handlers, and carriers. 
According to the licensee, the written program of veterinary care as well as acquisition records were still boxed due to the 
recent move.  These required records were unavailable for review during this new site inspection.  It is important for these 
documents be provided to the Aphis official to ensure that the animals have been appropriately acquired and that an 
attending veterinarian is employed, under formal arrangements, to provide care for all of the exhibit animals.   
 
Each dealer, exhibitor, operator of an auction sale, intermediate handler, and carrier shall furnish to any APHIS official 
any information concerning the business of the dealer, exhibitor, operator of an auction sale, intermediate handler or 
carrier which the APHIS official may request in connection with the enforcement of the provisions of the Act, the 
regulations and the standards in this subchapter. The information shall be furnished within a reasonable time and as may 
be specified in the request for information. 
 
 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY:  MAY 17, 2023

2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee has not developed, documented or followed an appropriate contingency plan as required.  The written plan 
should have been in place by July 5, 2022.  The plan should be signed and reviewed annually.  The contingency plan is 
necessary to ensure that animals are provided with humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care in the 
event of an emergency or disaster.   
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: MAY 17, 2023 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
